00022 #ifdef _WIN32
00023 #pragma once
00024 #endif
00025 #include <FdoStd.h>
00026 #include <fdo/Commands/ICommand.h>
00027 #include <fdo/Connections/IConnection.h>
00028 #include <fdo/Expression/Identifier.h>
00029 #include <fdo/Filter/Filter.h>
00030 
00031 /// \brief
00032 /// The FdoIFeatureCommand interface defines the behavior common 
00033 /// to all commands that operate on feature instances. The features to 
00034 /// be operated on are identified by their class and a filter. If the feature 
00035 /// provider supports inheritance in the schema capabilities, then the command 
00036 /// will operate on instances of that class and any derived classes. 
00037 /// In addition, feature commands can operate on related features if one or 
00038 /// more relation directives are specified. Each relation directive specifies 
00039 /// the relation to follow and how many levels of depth to follow it.
00040 class FdoIFeatureCommand :  public FdoICommand
00041 {
00042     friend class FdoIConnection;
00043 
00044 public:
00045     /// \brief
00046     /// Gets the name of the class to be operated upon as an identifier.
00047     /// 
00048     /// \return
00049     /// Returns nothing
00050     /// 
00051     FDO_API virtual FdoIdentifier* GetFeatureClassName() = 0;
00052 
00053     /// \brief
00054     /// Sets the name of the class to be operated upon as an identifier.
00055     /// 
00056     /// \param value 
00057     /// Input the class identifier
00058     /// 
00059     /// \return
00060     /// Returns nothing
00061     /// 
00062     FDO_API virtual void SetFeatureClassName(FdoIdentifier* value) = 0;
00063 
00064     /// \brief
00065     /// Sets the name of the class to be operated upon as an identifier.
00066     /// 
00067     /// \param value 
00068     /// Input the class name
00069     /// 
00070     /// \return
00071     /// Returns nothing
00072     /// 
00073     FDO_API virtual void SetFeatureClassName(GisString* value) = 0;
00074 
00075     /// \brief
00076     /// Gets the filter as a filter tree.
00077     /// 
00078     /// \return
00079     /// Returns the filter object
00080     /// 
00081     FDO_API virtual FdoFilter* GetFilter() = 0;
00082 
00083     /// \brief
00084     /// Sets the filter as a Filter tree.
00085     /// 
00086     /// \param value 
00087     /// Input the filter object
00088     /// 
00089     /// \return
00090     /// Returns nothing
00091     /// 
00092     FDO_API virtual void SetFilter(FdoFilter* value) = 0;
00093 
00094     /// \brief
00095     /// Sets the filter as a Filter tree.
00096     /// 
00097     /// \param value 
00098     /// Input the filter expression string
00099     /// 
00100     /// \return
00101     /// Returns nothing
00102     /// 
00103     FDO_API virtual void SetFilter(GisString* value) = 0;
00104 };
00105 #endif
